text: Consider a system employing interrupt-driven I/O for a particular device that transfers data at an average of 10000 bytes/sec on a continuous basis. Assume that interrupt processing takes about 100 microseconds (i.e., the time to jump to the interrupt service routine (ISR), execute it, and return to the main program). What fraction of processor time (in %) is consumed by this I/O device if it interrupts for every 2 bytes?
